Endemic Simulation LASER Configuration

config_simulation_endemic.Rd

A multi-year endemic parameter set that sustains low-level transmission and produces recurring seasonal + quadrennial waves via environmental persistence. The object is generated by make_simulated_LASER_config_files.R (sim_endemic) and saved in the package as config_simulation_endemic.

Usage

config_simulation_endemic

Format

A named list with the same structure as config_default but spanning five years of daily timesteps.

Details

AspectSetting
Time span1 Jan 2020 – 31 Dec 2024 (≈ 1 826 days).
Locations“FOO” (8 k), “BAR” (12 k), “BAZ” (20 k).
Initial mix25 % susceptible, 30 % first-dose vaccinated, 20 % recovered, ~0.5 % infectious (≥ 1 case each site).
TransmissionSite-specific baseline β: 0.18, 0.30, 0.24 with ±0.10 annual forcing (Fourier first harmonic).
EnvironmentSuitability ψjt = 0.55 + annual 0.25 sin (2π t/365) + quadrennial 0.15 sin (2π t/1 460); values clipped to 0,1.
Environmental half-lifedecay_days_long = 500 days (≈ 14 months).
Immunity waningω₁ ≈ 1/180 d (0.0056), ω₂ ≈ 1/300 d (0.0033).
Mobilityτi = 0.005, 0.002, 0.006 per day.
Observed datareported_cases / reported_deaths matrices filled with NA.
Seedset.seed(999999999) for full reproducibility.

Together, the longer environmental survival and waning immunity allow susceptibles to replenish, generating periodic endemic outbreaks without the explosive dynamics of the epidemic toy set.

See also

  • config_simulation_epidemic – one-year outbreak scenario.

  • config_default – comprehensive default configuration.

  • make_simulated_LASER_config_files.R (sim_endemic) – generator script.
